p: The reversible heat generation is calculated using eq 4 , as shown in Figure 6 . Because Δ S is always negative at all SODs, and I is negative in the discharge process, − TΔ S I/ nF is negative, exhibiting the heating effect. In the charging process, I is positive, so − TΔ S I/ nF is positive, exhibiting the cooling effect. The heating or cooling effect is rather strong from 80 to 90% SOD, for the absolute value of Δ S is large, and the structure changes severely in this range.
